revised_title: On the Development and Succession of Poison-Fangs in Snakes
tldr: The author examines the development and succession of poison-fangs in snakes, specifically focusing on the differences between viperine and colubrine poisonous snakes. The study reveals that the poison-fangs in viperine snakes develop in two parallel series, while in colubrine snakes, they develop in a single series similar to other Ophidian teeth. The research also discusses the unique features of the individual tooth-germ and the process of tooth fixation.
